German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From the same root as Gewicht (“weight”), thus pertaining to wiegen (“to weigh”). See also gewichtig, a (formal or elevated) synonym of wichtig. Weight is often used as a metaphor for importance; compare German schwerwiegend (“serious, grave”), as well as English weighty, heavy.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈvɪçtɪç/ (Northern Germany), IPA(key): /ˈvɪʃtɪʃ/ (Sachsen, Rheinland), IPA(key): /ˈviçtik/ (Southern Germany, Austria)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)
    IPA(key): /ˈviçtik/

Adjective[edit]

wichtig (comparative wichtiger, superlative am wichtigsten)

  1. important, relevant, significant
